tit.e: Selected intangible properties of folk culture
Selected intangible properties of folk culture
Selected intangible properties of folk culture

sen.j: 選択無形民俗文化財（せんたくむけいみんぞくぶんかざい）とは、重要無形民俗文化財以外の無形の民俗文化財のうち、記録、保存、公開に対して経費の一部を公費による補助を受けることができる。
sen.e: Selected intangible properties of folk culture refers an intangible cultural property (except the important intangible folk cultural property), which is allowed to receive financial aid at public cost to cover a part of the expense to record, preserve, and exhibit.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Selected intangible properties of folk culture refers to an intangible cultural property (except important intangible folk cultural properties), which is allowed to receive financial aid at public cost to cover a part of the expense to record, preserve, and exhibit.

Selected intangible properties of folk culture refers to an intangible cultural property (except important intangible folk cultural properties), which is allowed to receive financial aid at public cost to cover a part of the expense to record, preserve, and exhibit.

sen.j: 文化審議会の答申に基づき文化庁長官によって選択された文化財をいう。
sen.e: The cultural properties are selected by the Director-General of the Agency for Cultural Affairs based on the report of the Council for Cultural Affairs.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The cultural properties are selected by the Director-General of the Agency for Cultural Affairs based on the report of the Council for Cultural Affairs.
The cultural properties are selected by the Director-General of the Agency for Cultural Affairs based on the report of the Council for Cultural Affairs.

sen.j: 文化庁長官は、重要無形民俗文化財以外の無形の民俗文化財のうち特に必要のあるものを選択して、自らその記録を作成し、保存し、又は公開することができるものとしている。
sen.e: The Director-General of the Agency for Cultural Affairs may select especially needed properties among immaterial folk cultural properties except important intangible folk cultural property, and may produce the record, store or exhibit them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The Director-General of the Agency for Cultural Affairs may select especially needed properties among immaterial folk cultural properties except important intangible folk cultural properties, and may produce records, store or exhibit them.

The director-general of the Agency for Cultural Affairs may select especially needed properties among immaterial folk cultural properties except important intangible folk cultural properties, and may produce records, store or exhibit them.
sen.cmt: 大文字を小文字にしました。

sen.j: 国は、適当な者に対し、当該無形の民俗文化財の公開又はその記録の作成、保存若しくは公開に要する経費の一部を補助することができる（文化財保護法第91条で準用する第77条）としている。
sen.e: The state may financially support appropriate persons to cover a part of the expense to exhibit, record and preserve the intangible folk cultural properties (Article 77 applied with Article 91 of the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The state may financially support appropriate persons to cover a part of the expense to exhibit, record and preserve the intangible folk cultural properties (Article 77 applied with Article 91 of the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties).

The state may financially support appropriate persons to cover a part of the expense to exhibit, record and preserve the intangible folk cultural properties (Article 77 applied with Article 91 of the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties).

sen.j: この規定により文化庁長官によって選択されたものを、選択無形民俗文化財という。
sen.e: What was selected by Director-General of the Agency for Cultural Affairs according to this regulation is called selected intangible properties of folk culture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: What was selected by Director-General of the Agency for Cultural Affairs according to this regulation is called selected intangible properties of folk culture.
What was selected by the director-general of the Agency for Cultural Affairs according to this regulation is called selected intangible properties of folk culture.
sen.cmt: 大文字を小文字にしました。

sen.j: この選択無形民俗文化財という名称は、この規定にもとづいて選択された無形の民俗文化財を指す通称であり、法律上の用語ではない。
sen.e: The selected intangible properties of folk culture is a common name, which indicates the intangible folk cultural properties selected based on the regulation, and is not the legal term.
The selected intangible properties of folk culture is a common name, which indicates the intangible folk cultural properties selected based on the regulation, and is not a legal term.
The selected intangible properties of folk culture is a common name, which indicates the intangible folk cultural properties selected based on the regulation, and is not a legal term.

sen.j: 正式には記録作成等の措置を講ずべき無形の民俗文化財という。
sen.e: Officially, it is called Kirokusakusei-to no Sochi wo Kozubeki Mukei no Bunkazai (intangible folk cultural properties that should be taken measures, such as record creation).
Officially, they are called Kirokusakusei-to no Sochi wo Kozubeki Mukei no Bunkazai (intangible folk cultural properties selected for measures such as recording).
Officially, they are called intangible folk cultural properties selected for measures such as recording.
sen.cmt: 音訳部分は必要ないと思われます。

sen.j: 文化財の分類に関しては文化財の項目を参照。
sen.e: About classification of cultural properties, refer to the article of cultural properties.
Regarding classification of cultural properties, refer to the article on cultural properties.
Regarding classification of cultural properties, refer to the article on cultural properties.

sen.j: 「記録作成等の措置を講ずべき無形の民俗文化財の選択基準」が次のとおり規定されている。
sen.e: Kirokusakusei-to no Sochi wo Kozubeki Mukei no Bunkazai is stipulated as follows.
Kirokusakusei-to no Sochi wo Kozubeki Mukei no Bunkazai is stipulated as follows.
The selection criteria for intangible folk cultural properties selected for measures such as recording is stipulated as follows.
sen.cmt: 選択基準の部分を補足しました。

sen.j: 1.風俗慣習のうち、次の各号のいずれかに該当し、重要なもの
sen.e: 1. Important Manner and Custom that are applicable to one of the following Numbers.
1. Important Manners and Customs that are applicable to one of the following
1. Important manners and customs that are applicable to one of the following
sen.cmt: 大文字を小文字にしました。

sen.j: (1)由来、内容等において我が国民の基盤的な生活文化の特色を示すもので典型的なもの
sen.e: (1) One that shows typical features of Japanese foundational life and culture in origin, details, etc.
(1) One that shows typical features of Japanese foundational life and culture in origin, details, etc.
(1) One that shows typical features of Japanese foundational life and culture in origin, details, etc.

sen.j: (2)年中行事、祭礼、法会等の中で行われる行事で芸能の基盤を示すもの
sen.e: (2) An annual event or a event held in a festival, a memorial service, etc. that shows the foundation of performing arts.
(2) An annual event or event held in a festival, a memorial service, etc. that shows the foundation of performing arts.
(2) An annual event or event held in a festival, a memorial service, etc. that shows the foundation of performing arts.

sen.j: 2.民俗芸能のうち、次の各号のいずれかに該当し、重要なもの
sen.e: 2. Important Folk Performing Arts that are applicable to one of the following Numbers.
2. Important Folk Performing Arts that are applicable to one of the following
2. Important folk performing arts that are applicable to one of the following
sen.cmt: 大文字を小文字にしました。

sen.j: (1)芸能の発生又は成立を示すもの
sen.e: (1) What shows origination or formation of performing arts.
(1) What shows origination or formation of performing arts.
(1) What shows origination or formation of performing arts.

sen.j: (2)芸能の変遷の過程を示すもの
sen.e: (2) What shows the transition process of performing arts.
(2) What shows the transition process of performing arts.
(2) What shows the transition process of performing arts.

sen.j: (3)地域的特色を示すもの
sen.e: (3) What shows the regional characteristics.
(3) What shows the regional characteristics.
(3) What shows the regional characteristics.

sen.j: 3.民俗技術のうち、次の各号のいずれかに該当し、重要なもの
sen.e: 3. Important folk technologies that are applicable to one of the following Numbers.
3. Important folk technologies that are applicable to one of the following
3. Important folk technologies that are applicable to one of the following

sen.j: (1)技術の発生又は成立を示すもの
sen.e: (1) What shows origination or formation of technologies.
(1) What shows origination or formation of technologies.
(1) What shows origination or formation of technologies.

sen.j: (2)技術の変遷の過程を示すもの
sen.e: (2) What shows the transition process of technologies.
(2) What shows the transition process of technologies.
(2) What shows the transition process of technologies.

sen.j: (3)地域的特色を示すもの
sen.e: (3) What shows the regional characteristics.
(3) What shows the regional characteristics.
(3) What shows the regional characteristics.

sen.j: 4.無形の民俗文化財のうち前3号には該当しないが、重要有形民俗文化財の特質を理解するために特に必要なもの
sen.e: 4. Immaterial folk cultural properties that are not applicable to the above three numbers yet are especially necessary in order to understand the characteristics of important tangible folk cultural properties.

4. Immaterial folk cultural properties that are not applicable to the above three numbers yet are especially necessary in order to understand the characteristics of important tangible folk cultural properties.

4. Immaterial folk cultural properties that are not applicable to the above three numbers yet are especially necessary in order to understand the characteristics of important tangible folk cultural properties.

sen.j: 5.我が国民以外の人々に係る前各号に規定する無形の民俗文化財で我が国民の生活文化との関連上特に重要なもの
sen.e: 5. Foreign Immaterial Folk Cultural Properties that are Stipulated in the previous Numbers and especially important in connection with Japanese people's lives and cultures.
5. Foreign Immaterial Folk Cultural Properties that are Stipulated in the previous Numbers and especially important in connection with Japanese people's lives and cultures.
5. Foreign immaterial folk cultural properties that are Stipulated in the previous numbers and especially important in connection with Japanese people's lives and cultures.
sen.cmt: 大文字を小文字にしました。

sen.j: 「記録作成等の措置を講ずべき無形の民俗文化財の選択基準」に基づき、これらに該当するものついて、文化庁長官が「記録作成等の措置を講ずべき無形の民俗文化財」（通称「選択無形民俗文化財」）として選択し、地方公共団体の行う調査事業や記録作成の事業に助成を行っている。
sen.e: Based on "the selection criterion for Kirokusakusei-to no Sochi wo Kozubeki Mukei no Bunkazai, such as record creation, Director-General of the Agency for Cultural Affairs selects "Kirokusakusei-to no Sochi wo Kozubeki Mukei no Bunkazai" (commonly known as "selected intangible properties of folk culture") and supports a local public entity's research project and record making project.

Based on "the selection criteria for Kirokusakusei-to no Sochi wo Kozubeki Mukei no Bunkazai, such as record creation, Director-General of the Agency for Cultural Affairs selects "Kirokusakusei-to no Sochi wo Kozubeki Mukei no Bunkazai" (commonly known as "selected intangible properties of folk culture") and supports a local public entity's research project and record making project.

Based on 'the selection criteria for intangible folk cultural properties selected for measures such as recording, the director-general of the Agency for Cultural Affairs selects 'intangible folk cultural properties selected for measures such as recording' (commonly known as 'selected intangible properties of folk culture') and supports a local public entity's research project and record making project.

sen.j: 2005年に施行された改正文化財保護法により、無形の民俗文化財の領域に「民俗技術」が加えられた。
sen.e: The "folk technology" was added to the area of intangible folk cultural properties in the Revised Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties, enforced in 2005.
The "folk technology" was added to the area of intangible folk cultural properties in the Revised Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties, enacted in 2005.
The 'folk technology' was added to the area of intangible folk cultural properties in the Revised Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties, enacted in 2005.

sen.j: この改正に伴い、2008年、民俗技術として最初に「中津川の鉄砲堰製作技術」が選択された。
sen.e: Accompanying to the revision, "Nakatsugawa technique to make a dam to convey wood" was selected first as a folk technology in 2008.
Accompanying to the revision, "Nakatsugawa technique to make a dam to convey wood" was selected first as a folk technology in 2008.
Accompanying to the revision, 'Nakatsugawa technique to make a dam to convey wood' was selected first as a folk technology in 2008.

sen.j: 2008年3月13日現在、次の572件が選択されている。
sen.e: By March 13, 2008, following 572 entities have been selected.
By March 13, 2008, the following 572 entities have been selected.
By March 13, 2008, the following 572 entities have been selected.
